topics.body:
"You know deep ones
and dark young
and shantaks
and shoggoths

Night guants
and polyps
and fungi from Yuggoth

But do you recall
The most loathsome beastie of all?

Freddie the red brain Mi-go
had a very slimy brain
and if you ever saw it
you would scream and go insane!

All of the other Mi-go
laughed at him and made remarks
they never let poor Freddie
whisper with them in the dark!

Then one foggy solistice eve
Cthulhu came to say,
Freddie with your brain so bright,
won't you scare some folks tonight?

Then all the Mi-go loved him
as they buzzed about the place,
Freddie the red brained mi-go,
you'll live out in darkest space!":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rU85OUr7iN8

"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547ff1a96368720cff990200#post_547ff1a96368720cff990200
Hacevya un tiempo tuvieron una idea muy fresca de hacer un concurso sobre como sería un AC en Brasil, las ideas que salieron fueron, a minmodo de ver, muy prometedoras, esperemos que hagan algo con eso pronto. Yo sueño tadavía que manden a Connor en sus 50s ó 60s a Uruguay para ayudar a Don. José. Artigas. Si Ezio pudo seguir de loco en Constantinopla ya de anciano, porqué no Connor? Ademas cumpliría su tradición de utilizar escenarios no tam conocidos que los ha guiado hasta ahora. El campo sudamericano era tan interesante o más que las ciudades. Por si quieres exhar un ojo a esto de Brasil en Deviantart está todo solo ponle AC Brasil y ahí tendrás.

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547ff5316368725437930000#post_547ff5316368725437930000
Not really; when you get down to it there is one absolute: that everything the universe is infinite.

Sounds are merely compressions of air; the limitation of sound is what we can hear and the limitation of that is that there are only a select number of types of sounds that are pleasurable to people.  The question is how many sounds can we possibly create that are pleasurable.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547ffb386368720b608c0100#post_547ffb386368720b608c0100
Hmmmm....
A construction company. And most of he oldest companies on the list are Japanese. My lord, not only do Japanese have the longest national average lifespan, but also longest lifespan for businesses. Though, there is also a pub in Ireland that has been operating since 700s, during the Middle Ages.

Japanese are amazing at preservation. And I believe the Chinese should learn from on how to preserve their heritage instead from trying to trash it like they attempted during the Cultural Revolution. Damn those culturecidal Marxist Red Guards...

That is a huge gap between the first and second by almost 200 years. How do the Japanese do it? Preserving all of these firms. I heard there were like 10 schools of swordmaking in Japan 500 years old and to this day.
